page.title: 02Ollerton Colliery
page.content: { Ollerton Colliery}is the primary reason why the present-day village of New Ollerton exists. The pit first produced coal in 1926.The total cost of establishing the colliery, including new housing for the workers,was about Â£1,500,000.Since that date both the pit and the village have expanded considerably. There are 1240 people working at the colliery (plus seven canaries!), and current{production}is 4,500 tonnes per day.Approximately 70% of the workforce live within our Domesday Survey area. Four-fifths of the coal produced goes to Trent Valley power stations (mainly by rail),while the remainder goes to industrial users,some of them abroad.
